content: Hi...We have a query related to the Pediatric Profiles, we support the other profiles under the Vital Signs but we don't consider the data capture for the pediatric profiles. Do we need to use the dataabsentreason for Pediatric Profiles to pass all the inferno test cases or there is other way to justify it? Please suggest.
DataAbsentReason does not pass the test. USCDI mandates these data requirement. https://www.healthit.gov/isa/united-states-core-data-interoperability-uscdi

Ok...It means we need to mandatorily support and implement all the pediatric Profiles with all capabilities i.e.
US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation Profile
US Core Pediatric Head Occipital-frontal Circumference Percentile Profile
US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation Profile
even though we are supporting other Vital Sign Profile Supported Profile/Other Vital Sign USCDI Data Elements like US Core Blood Pressure Profile or US Core Body Weight Profile. Is my understanding correct on this?
Yes. Server has to support all Vital Sign data elements listed in USCDI (https://www.healthit.gov/isa/uscdi-data/vital-signs#uscdi-v1)
Got It....Thank you so much, @Yunwei Wang ....!!

@Yunwei Wang : The confusion is between the Inferno requirements and the Core Profile Implementation Guide.

The US CORE IG 3.2.0 for US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation Profile mentions the "Observation.value[x]:valueQuantity.value" is the must support element (http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core/StructureDefinition-pediatric-bmi-for-age.html#profile). It is not a codable type element.

Now Considering the Search guidelines of Missing Data Elements for Must Support Elements (http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core/conformance-expectations.html#must-support-elements), it states that value 'unknown' or 'specific reason if known (In our case use of unsupported)' from the dataabsentreason value set can be used by the server in the data response.

The Guidelines Mentions as following:
**- In situations where information on a particular data element is not present and the reason for absence is unknown, US Core Responders SHALL NOT include the data elements in the resource instance returned as part of the query results."

  • In situations where information on a particular data element is missing and the US Core Responder knows the precise reason for the absence of data (other than suppressed data), US Core Responders SHOULD send the reason for the missing information. This is done by following the same methodology outlined in the Missing Data section, but using the appropriate reason code instead of unknown.**

Please suggest on this confusion. Thanks.

First, US Core 3.2.0 is in balloting process. Inferno Community and Inferno Program are both test again the latest released version, US Core v3.1.1 (http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/)
Can you clarify what the confusion is?

@Yunwei Wang where does the notion of "Patient + 1" come into play here? because I would have thought that a system can elect to support a pediatric profile or not a long as they meet the patient + 1 requirement.
Hmm. Have not heard that term for more than a year. Good point. I will double check that and get back to you.

@Eric Haas I did some research on the change logs. Inferno started with Patient + 1 approach that a server must support at least one additional US Core profile in addition to US Core patient for US Core conformance test. On top of that ONC said that for server must support all USCDI elements for ONC certification test.
@Nihar Sorry I should make it clear that this is for Inferno Program. If you are using US Core 3.1.1 testing in Inferno Community, test skips those resources/profiles that your server does not support.

@Yunwei Wang : Thank you so much...!!! This means per ONC, all USCDI elements are required for Certification. Also, in certification we will be demonstrating the Inferno Program for verification so we need to ideally comply with the pediatric profile elements.
Nihar has marked this topic as resolved.
